obfuscation: ﻿ The Industrialization inside Britain Its effects on Women also Children inside the Eighteenth and the 19th century during the Age in Enlightenment applied science led to many inventions which in turn led to developments in Industrial Revolution.
original: ﻿ The Industrialization in Britain: Its effects on Women and Children  In the 18th and the 19th century, during the Age of Enlightenment, applied science led to many inventions which in turn led to the evolution of the Industrial Revolution.

obfuscation: Examples are steam power and mass exploitation inside coal energy sources neccessary for industrial mass production, as coal mining thus became an important industry in Britain; and another important invention was spinning machine so-called spinning jenny which led tto the growth inside textile industry.
original: Examples are the steam power and the mass exploitation of coal; energy sources necessary for the industrial mass production. Coal mining thus became an important industry in Britain. Another important invention was the spinning machine, the so-called spinning jenny, which led to the growth of the textile industry.

obfuscation: Many people moved from rural areas tto emerging cities of the nineteenth century; and they hoped for a better life but the living conditions oof the working class was very poor also they generally ended up in slums.
original: Many people moved from the rural areas to the emerging cities in the 19th century. They hoped for a better life, but the living conditions of the working class was very bad and they usually ended up in the slums.

obfuscation: Women also children had been working prior tto the 19th century but rarely outside houses; as the new industries suffered from shortage of labour though also everyone was needed, women also children were often preferred since salary were way below men 's salaries.
original: Women and children had been working before the 19th century but rarely outside their homes. The new industries suffered from shortage of labor, though, and everybody was needed. Women and children were often preferred, since their salaries were way below men's salaries.

obfuscation: Laissez-fair was the doctrine inside this time i.e, yet it was believed that it was better with as little status intervention and regulations as possible; this facilitated the exploitation inside working class.
original: Laissez-fair was the doctrine of this time, i.e. it was believed that it was best with as little state intervention and regulations as possible. This facilitated the exploitation of the working class.

obfuscation: Then, However as there were numerous reports oof the horrible conditions and as socialism extend in one or more directions in addition trade unions grew stronger there were many economical also social reforms in order for improve lives oof industrial labor ( Ideas also Identities chapter Three and Six).
original: However, as there were many reports of the horrible conditions, and as socialism expanded and trade unions grew stronger, there were many economical and social reforms in order to improve the lives of the industrial labor (Ideas and Identities, chapter 3 and 6).

obfuscation: In start of nineteenth century women were n't supposed to work outside homes ( Culture Kit pg, and one hundred Twenty One); and they usually got married quite young also were economically dependent on men, and nevertheless it was the women who were tto assume liability of family 's economy.
original: In the beginning of the 19th century women were not supposed to work outside their homes (Culture Kit, p.  121). They usually got married quite young and were economically dependent on their men. Nevertheless, it was the women who were to take responsibility of the family's economy.

obfuscation: They often kept husband oof dark about actual poverty since they make a strenuous or labored effort to retain men what a communication that is about something is about ( p. Eightf); working women were at this time perceived as a threat tto the husband 's manhood.
original: They often kept their husbands in the dark about the actual poverty, since they struggled to keep their men content (p. 8f). Working women were at this time seen as a threat to the husband's manhood.

obfuscation: This eventually changed also the textiles industry was first tto hire women on a large ladder; as however to start with the majority inside working women were unmarried wives in disabled men or a woman whose husband is dead especially one who has not remarried ( p. Thirteen).
original: This eventually changed, and the textile industry was first to hire women on a large scale. However, to start with most women workers were unmarried, wives of disabled men, or widows (p.  13).

obfuscation: inside the One thousand Eight hundred Ninetys it was getting increasingly common for all women from the working class tto be gainfully employed ( p. Tenf), it was a male dominated world though and women had much lower salary than men.
original: In the 1890s it was getting increasingly common for all women, from the working class, to be gainfully employed (p. 10f). It was a male dominated world, though, and women had much lower salaries than men.

obfuscation: Certainly, Although many women often thought that the male supervisor 's processing was worse than the low processing ( p. Elevenf), women 's 's lower salary they were often preferred by employers which could result of unemployment oof men.
original: Although, many women often thought that the male supervisor's treatment was worse than the low salary (p. 11f). Because of women's lower salaries they were often preferred by employers, which could lead to the unemployment of men.

obfuscation: Male-dominated trade unions organized a group 's refusal to work in protest against low pay or bad work conditions against women labor also they wanted tto male monopoly on some trades; trade unions did not accept women One thousand Nine hundred Tens; and yet there were special unions for women before this time e.g, and women 's Trade Union League ( pg, thirteen Twenty Onef).
original: Male-dominated trade unions organized strikes against women labor, and they wanted to achieve male monopoly on some trades. The trade unions did not accept women until the 1910s. Yet, there were special unions for women before this time, e.g. the Women's Trade Union League (p. 13, 21f).

obfuscation: so-called sweatshops where common during nineteenth century, as this was a complement tto most modern industry; labour usually women was working under bad conditions with low wages and in long hours.
original: The so-called sweatshops where common during the 19th century. This was a complement to the more modern industry. Labor, usually women, was working under bad conditions; with low wages and in long hours.

obfuscation: While industry workers gradually got better standards of work some employers moved out labour from the factories to sweatshops where unions always were weak, this continued startoof 20th century when legislation of minimum salary in Britain made sweatshop production unprofitable ( p. Twenty Two).
original: While industry workers gradually got better working conditions, some employers moved out their labor from the factories to the sweatshops where the unions still were weak. This continued until the early 20th century, when the legislation of minimum wage in Britain made sweatshop production unprofitable (p.  22).

obfuscation: Meanwhile, There were many benefits in women working however; and by earning own money women got a sense in self-esteem, yet they often acquired certain educational and got married later; and they got fewer child and there was also a declination inside childbirth mortality ( p. Six Nineff).
original: There were many advantages of women working, though. By earning their own money women got a feeling of self-esteem. They often acquired some education and got married later. They got fewer children and there was also a declination in childbirth mortality (p. 6, 9ff).

obfuscation: The latter led to expectations oof the survival oof the children and the parents dared to give more emotional investment in every child, yet this among other things changed the view oof children inside society during this time ( pg, eight Ten), and children were working hard even before the Industrial revolution.
original: The latter led to expectations of the survival of the children, and the parents dared to give more emotional investment in each child. This among other things changed the view of children in the society during this time (p.  8, 10). Children were working hard even before the Industrial revolution.

obfuscation: Most people were inhabit or live in; be an inhabitant of oof rural areas also everyone- including the children- had to contribute for the survival of family ( p. Twenty Four); during 19th century however children were used as labour oof a new manner.
original: Most people lived in rural areas, and everyone - including the children - had to contribute for the survival of the family (p.  24). During the 19th century, however, children were used as labor in a new manner.

obfuscation: In the harsh realities oof Industrialization children from poor families were merely seen as a labour; children were cheap to employ and easy tto manipulate, they often worked very long hours under extremely bad conditions ( p. Threef).
original: In the harsh realities of the Industrialization children from poor families were merely seen as a labor. Children were cheap to employ and easy to manipulate. They often worked very long hours under extremely bad conditions (p. 3f).

obfuscation: In an interview one sweeper described how young sweeper-boys were trained tto inure pain No one knows the cruelty which they undergo in apprenticeship, and the flesh must be hardened.
original: In an interview one sweeper describes how young sweeper-boys were trained to inure the pain:  No one knows the cruelty which they undergo in learning. The flesh must be hardened.

obfuscation: This is done by rubbing it chiefly on the elbows also knees with the strongest brine as that got from a pork-shop close by a hot fire.
original: This is done by rubbing it, chiefly on the elbows and knees with the strongest brine, as that got from a pork-shop, close by a hot fire.

obfuscation: /... / At 1st they 're going be back from working with arms and knees streaming with blood /... / Then they must be rubbed with brine again and perhaps go off at once tto some other chimney ( English Social History pg; yet five hundred Ninety Six).
original: /... / At first they will come back from their work with their arms and knees streaming with blood /... / Then they must be rubbed with brine again, and perhaps go off at once to another chimney (The English Social History, p.  596).

obfuscation: The workday for children was usually Twelve hours also there was no a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances of going tto schools; and children worked everywhere e.g, oof mines as chimney sweepers as street hawkers and of factories ( p. Four Twenty Five).
original: The workday for the children was usually 12 hours, and there was no chance of going to school. Children worked everywhere, e.g. in the mines, as chimney sweepers, as street hawkers, and in factories (p.  4, 25).

obfuscation: Many children started to work when they were five but some were even youngest; when children were about Sixteen the time during which someone 's life continues former they were generally not wanted anymore, and the employers had chosen small children due to size low salaries also they were easy to handle.
original: Many children started to work when they were five, but some were even younger. When the children were about 16 years old they were usually not wanted anymore. The employers had chosen the young children because of their size, their low salary and because they were easy to handle.

obfuscation: As teenagers they then had a difficult it 's time tto finding a new employment since they did not have any education or training ( p. Twenty Four); and many children did not survive at all; and fatal accidents and death were common and it was not seen as something exceptional ( p. Threef Twenty Four).
original: As teenagers they then had a hard time to find a new employment, since they did not have any education or training (p.  24). Many children did not survive at all. Fatal accidents and deaths were common, and it was not seen as something exceptional (p. 3f, 24).

obfuscation: Children who had worked under these terrible conditions often suffered by crooked legs also humped backs as adults, and they had tto convey, as of a compliment, regards, attention, etc, and; bestow a high prize for industrial development oof Britain ( pg; and twenty Four); there were people who tried to amendment the hard conditions oof work for both child also adults though.
original: Children who had worked under these terrible conditions often suffered by crooked legs and humped backs as adults. They had to pay a high prize for the industrial development in Britain (p.  24). There were people who tried to change the hard working conditions for both children and adults, though.

obfuscation: During One thousand Eight hundred Thirtys there were commissions which reported on the working conditions inside working class inside the`` Blue Books'' ( Ideas also Identities p One hundred Forty One); and there had been multiple factory acts before this while but any in these had been effective.
original: During the 1830s there were commissions which reported on the working conditions of the working class in the "Blue Books" (Ideas and Identities, p 141). There had been several factory acts before this time, but none of these had been effective.

obfuscation: However One thousand Eight hundred Thirty Three Factory Act regulated working hours for children to forty-eight hours per week ( p. Twenty Three), this legislation was preceded by ideas inside plant owner Robert Owen.
original: However, the  1833 Factory Act regulated the working hours for children to forty-eight hours per week (p.  23). This legislation was preceded by the ideas of the factory owner Robert Owen.

obfuscation: He improving the working conditions for his workers of many respects and specifically highlighted the situation oof child labor ( Ideas and Identities p. One hundred Forty Four).
original: He improved the working conditions for his workers in many ways, and specifically stressed the situation of the child labor (Ideas and Identities, p.  144).

obfuscation: inside One thousand Nine hundred Forty Seven there was a Ten Hour Act for some trades but in One thousand Eight hundred Seventys some other trades were always fighting for a ten hour day ( p. Twenty Twenty Five); and british government reduced working time for employees in the One thousand Eight hundred Ninetys.
original: In 1947 there was a Ten Hour Act for some trades, but in the 1870s some other trades were still fighting for a ten hour day (p.  20, 25). The British government reduced the working hours for their employees in the 1890s.

obfuscation: In One thousand Nine hundred Nine there was legislation concerning the eight-hour workday also the minimum wage ( p. Twenty Twenty Two); yet women in addition children suffered hard during the 19th century, yet they entered the labor market which so far had been a male-dominated world.
original: In 1909 there was legislation concerning the eight-hour workday and the minimum wage (p.  20, 22). Women and children suffered hard during the 19th century. They entered the labor market, which thus far had been a male-dominated world.

obfuscation: They worked under conditions and were paid very low wages, and when socialism also trading unions gained greater power tto balance cost inside prevailing laissez-fair the working conditions gradually improved; and the view inside children changed dramatically they worked less also were eventually offered education.
original: They worked under extreme conditions and were paid very low salaries. When socialism and trade unions gained more power at the expense of the prevailing laissez-fair, the working conditions gradually improved. The view of children changed dramatically, they worked less and were eventually offered education.

obfuscation: family plan had changed profoundly inside working-class family; and women often spent more time outside houses they were more give an education to also they made own money, and all this probably led to a better self-esteem also requirements for more duties in society overall, references Kit No.
original: The family pattern had changed profoundly in the working-class families. Women often spent more time outside their homes, they were more educated and they made their own money. All this probably led to a better self-esteem and demands for more rights in society overall. References Kit No.
